Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior, now flaked away in parts, is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of one line of red-painted Coptic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394184) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394184)
